title: Opportunity Index 2016
description: Opportunity index provides a snapshot of conditions that can be used to identify and improve access to opportunity - in comprehensive terms - for residents and their communities. The data and full analysis online show how opportunity index scores have changed over time and what access to opportunity looks like today.
creator: Child Trends and the Forum for Youth Investment’s Opportunity Nation campaign
publisher: Child Trends and the Forum for Youth Investment’s Opportunity Nation campaign
provider: Healthy Regions & Policies Lab, University of Illinois, Urbana-Champaign
data_variables: Poverty (% of population below poverty line)
80/20 Ratio (ratio of household income at the 80th percentile to that of the 20th percentile)
Banking Institutions (commercial banks, savings institutions, and credit unions per 10,000 residents)
Households spending less than 30% of household income on housing costs (%)
High-speed Internet (% of households for states; 5-level categories for counties)
On-time high school graduation (% of freshmen who graduate in four years)
Associate’s degree or higher (% of adults 25 and older)
Percentage of adults ages 18 and over-involved in social, civic, sports, and religious groups
Percentage of adults ages 18 and older who did volunteer work any time in the previous year
Young people not in school and not working (% ages 16-24)
Grocery stores and produce vendors (per 10,000 population)
